availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Peter Hiatt (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Hiatt. Father of Angeline Hiatt and James Hiatt. Farmer in Rockcastle County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from October 9, 1861 to December 9, 1861. Served in the 12th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from May 23, 1863 to December 31, 1863.

ab.bibl:

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 256.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #480464, Certificate #311104.
